info.name: Assemble Contigs from Reads
info.subtitle: Assemble DNA reads into a set of contigs.
info.tooltip: Assemble DNA reads into a set of contigs.

parameters.short_hint: List of read libraries
Enter a name for the assembled contigs data object

parameters.description: This method can assemble contigs using several "recipes" or curated workflows that can provide intelligent pipelines, automatic parameter selection, or multi-assembler comparisons (see manual page for more information)
parameters.short_hint: This method can assemble contigs using several "recipes" or curated workflows that can provide intelligent pipelines, automatic parameter selection, or multi-assembler comparisons (see manual page for more information)

parameters.description: An assembler listed below can be chosen as the preferred tool for assembly.
parameters.short_hint: An assembler listed below can be chosen as the preferred tool for assembly.

parameters.description: Allows the user to rapidly build a customized pipeline combination using the set of available preprocessing, assembly, and postprocessing tools (see the technical description in the manual page for more information); a pipeline is specified via a space-separated string, e.g: bhammer velvet
parameters.short_hint: Allows the user to rapidly build a customized pipeline combination using the set of available preprocessing, assembly, and postprocessing tools (see the technical description in the manual page for more information); a pipeline is specified via a space-separated string, e.g: bhammer velvet
Minimum length of contigs to output, default 300

info.subtitle: Generate a draft metabolic model based on an annotated genome.
info.name: MODELSEED - Build Metabolic Model
info.tooltip: Generate a draft metabolic model based on an annotated genome.

fixed_parameters.description: Models are generated based on a default template model in KBase. Template models capture the necessary biochemical information based on user-defined scope. KBase primarily uses four template models: (i) Gram positive microbe, (ii) Gram negative microbe, (iii) Core pathways microbe, (iv) Plant. These template models differ from each other by biomass composition and biochemical reaction functional associations. KBase users currently do not have the option to choose or alter the default template model

parameters.description: A genome including functional annotations generated by KBase

text_options.placeholder: Genome ID for the model to be generated

parameters.short_hint: A genome including functional annotations generated by KBase

parameters.description: Enter a name for the metabolic model to be created.
parameters.short_hint: Enter a name for the metabolic model to be created.

parameters.description: User has the option to generate a core metabolic model that contains central metabolic pathways, electron transport chains and fermentation pathways that are essential for energy biosynthesis (microbial genomes only)
parameters.short_hint: User has the option to generate a core metabolic model that contains central metabolic pathways, electron transport chains and fermentation pathways that are essential for energy biosynthesis (microbial genomes only)

parameters.description: Generate a metabolic model that includes all biochemical reactions in the entire database
parameters.short_hint: Generate a metabolic model that includes all biochemical reactions in the entire database

parameters.description: Models are generated based on a default template model in KBase. Template models capture the necessary biochemical information based on user-defined scope. KBase primarily uses four template models: (i) Gram positive microbe, (ii) Gram negative microbe, (iii) Core pathways microbe, and (iv) Plant. These template models differ from each other by biomass composition and biochemical reaction functional associations. KBase users currently do not have the option to choose or alter the default template model.
parameters.short_hint: Models are generated based on a default template model in KBase. Template models capture the necessary biochemical information based on user-defined scope. KBase primarily uses four template models: (i) Gram positive microbe, (ii) Gram negative microbe, (iii) Core pathways microbe, and (iv) Plant. These template models differ from each other by biomass composition and biochemical reaction functional associations. KBase users currently do not have the option to choose or alter the default template model.
Select a RNASeqAnalysis object to view

info.subtitle: Use Flux Balance Analysis (FBA) to predict metabolic fluxes in a metabolic model of an organism grown on a given media.
info.name: MODELSEED - Run Flux Balance Analysis
info.tooltip: Use Flux Balance Analysis (FBA) to predict metabolic fluxes in a metabolic model of an organism grown on a given media.

parameters.description: The metabolic network model consisting of genome-wide set of stoichiometric reactions, compounds, and the weighted components of the biomass on which you wish to carry out Flux Balance Analysis
parameters.short_hint: The metabolic network model consisting of genome-wide set of stoichiometric reactions, compounds, and the weighted components of the biomass on which you wish to carry out Flux Balance Analysis

parameters.description: User selects a media condition on which to simulate growth of the organism. If nothing is selected, the complete media is used by default
parameters.short_hint: Media specifies the set of chemical compounds organism can use for its growth

parameters.description: The fluxes for all reactions in the metabolic model and the predicted growth of the biomass according to the FBA model
parameters.short_hint: The fluxes for all reactions in the metabolic model and the predicted growth of the biomass according to the FBA model

parameters.description: Check this box to minimize and maximize all reaction fluxes, enabling reaction classification
parameters.short_hint: Check this box to minimize and maximize all reaction fluxes, enabling reaction classification

parameters.description: User could simulate FBA on single gene knockouts for all the genes in the model identifying essential reactions that carry fluxes on a given media condition
parameters.short_hint: User could simulate FBA on single gene knockouts for all the genes in the model identifying essential reactions that carry fluxes on a given media condition

parameters.description: Default is 0, which means "no"; by default, FBA will attempt to maximize its objective (usually biomass growth). If this option is checked which means "yes", FBA will attempt to minimize the sum of all fluxes following the biomass optimization
parameters.short_hint: Default is 0, which means "no"; by default, FBA will attempt to maximize its objective (usually biomass growth). If this option is checked which means "yes", FBA will attempt to minimize the sum of all fluxes following the biomass optimization

parameters.description: ID of reaction flux to maximize in flux balance analysis (e.g. rxn00001, cpd00001_e0, bio1)
parameters.short_hint: ID of reaction flux to maximize in flux balance analysis (e.g. rxn00001, cpd00001_e0, bio1)

parameters.description: Custom bounds on reaction or exchange flux (e.g. 0;rxn00001;5, 0;cpd00001_e0;5)
parameters.short_hint: Custom bounds on reaction or exchange flux (e.g. 0;rxn00001;5, 0;cpd00001_e0;5)

parameters.description: User may add gene knockout information one at a time using    add another gene knockout    button. Gene IDs should be in the same format that appears in your metabolic model (e.g., kb|g.220339.CDS.2927)
parameters.short_hint: User may add gene knockout information one at a time using    add another gene knockout    button. Gene IDs should be in the same format that appears in your metabolic model (e.g., kb|g.220339.CDS.2927)

parameters.description: User may add reaction knockout information one at a time using    add another reaction knockout    button. Reaction IDs should be in the same format that appears in your metabolic model (e.g rxn00002_c0)
parameters.short_hint: User may add reaction knockout information one at a time using    add another reaction knockout    button. Reaction IDs should be in the same format that appears in your metabolic model (e.g rxn00002_c0)

parameters.description: Specify additional compounds to add to media one at a time by using    add another additional compound    button
parameters.short_hint: Specify additional compounds to add to media one at a time by using    add another additional compound    button

parameters.description: An imported ExpressionMatrix containing gene expression values, one condition (column) of which will be used to constrain reaction activity in FBA
parameters.short_hint: An imported ExpressionMatrix containing gene expression values, one condition (column) of which will be used to constrain reaction activity in FBA

parameters.description: Specific condition in expression matrix to which reaction activity in FBA should be fit
parameters.short_hint: Specific condition in expression matrix to which reaction activity in FBA should be fit

parameters.description: Reactions with expression values in the percentile above this threshold are considered ON; if below, they are considered OFF
parameters.short_hint: Reactions with expression values in the percentile above this threshold are considered ON; if below, they are considered OFF

parameters.description: Reactions with expression values in a percentile that is within this uncertainty of the expression threshold will not be classified as on or off
parameters.short_hint: Range of uncertainty for classification of reaction activity based on expression threshold

parameters.description: If checked, all expression values associated with a set of universally active genes will be sorted, and the value at the percentile set by Expression Threshold will be used to set activity all genes in the genome
parameters.short_hint: Use expression threshold value (above) as the percentile of universal gene expression to use to set final threshold for gene activity

parameters.description: What fraction of the optimal objective value should be transcriptomics FBA problem be constrained at? Values between 0 and 1. 1 is not recommended.
parameters.short_hint: What fraction of the optimal objective value should be transcriptomics FBA problem be constrained at? Values between 0 and 1.

parameters.description: If checked, discrete binary variables are used for reaction activity and reaction slack in transcriptomic FBA. FBA will be slower. FVA will be much slower.
parameters.short_hint: If checked, discrete binary variables are used for reaction activity and reaction slack in transcriptomic FBA. FBA will be slower. FVA will be much slower.

parameters.description: Maximum number of moles of carbon permitted for uptake (default uptake rates varies from 0 to 100 for all nutrients)
parameters.short_hint: Maximum number of moles of carbon permitted for uptake (default uptake rates varies from 0 to 100 for all nutrients)

parameters.description: Maximum number of moles of nitrogen permitted for uptake (default uptake rates varies from 0 to 100 for all nutrients)
parameters.short_hint: Maximum number of moles of nitrogen permitted for uptake (default uptake rates varies from 0 to 100 for all nutrients)

parameters.description: Maximum number of moles of sulfur permitted for uptake (default uptake rates varies from 0 to 100 for all nutrients)
parameters.short_hint: Maximum number of moles of sulfur permitted for uptake (default uptake rates varies from 0 to 100 for all nutrients)

parameters.description: Maximum number of moles of phosphate permitted for uptake (default uptake rates varies from 0 to 100 for all nutrients)
parameters.short_hint: Maximum number of moles of phosphate permitted for uptake (default uptake rates varies from 0 to 100 for all nutrients)

info.name: Trimmomatic - Read Trimming - v0.36
info.subtitle: Trim paired- or single-end Illumina reads with Trimmomatic.
info.tooltip: Trim paired- or single-end Illumina reads with Trimmomatic.

parameter_groups.short_hint: Configure if you wish to remove standard adapters

parameters.description: The read library or read library set for which you want to trim.
parameters.short_hint: The read library or read library set to examine

parameters.description: Base name for output read library or read library set object
parameters.short_hint: Base name for output read library or read library set object

parameters.description: Modernize and standardize phred64 (Illumina <= 1.7) read quality encoding format to phred33 (Sanger, 454, SRA, Illumina >= 1.8).  Does nothing if already phred33.
parameters.short_hint: Modernize and standardize phred64 (Illumina <= 1.7) read quality encoding format to phred33 (Sanger, 454, SRA, Illumina >= 1.8).
parameters.ui_name: Translate quality encoding from phred64 to phred33

parameters.description: The reference adapter sequences.
parameters.short_hint: The reference sequences for trimming.

parameters.description: Specifies the maximum mismatch count which will still allow a full match to be performed.
parameters.short_hint: Maximum mismatch count which will still allow a full match.

parameters.description: Specifies how accurate the match between the two 'adapter ligated' reads must be for PE palindrome read alignment.
parameters.short_hint: Specifies how accurate the match between the two 'adapter ligated' reads must be for PE palindrome read alignment.

parameters.description: Specifies how accurate the match between any adapter etc. sequence must be against a read.
parameters.short_hint: Specifies how accurate the match between any adapter etc. sequence must be against a read.

parameters.description: Perform a sliding window trimming, cutting once the average quality within the window falls below a threshold. By considering multiple bases, a single poor quality base will not cause the removal of high quality data later in the read.
parameters.short_hint: Specifies the number of bases to average across.

parameters.description: Perform a sliding window trimming, cutting once the average quality within the window falls below a threshold. By considering multiple bases, a single poor quality base will not cause the removal of high quality data later in the read.
parameters.short_hint: Specifies the average quality required.

parameters.description: Removes bases regardless of quality from the end of the read, so that the read has maximally the specified length after this step has been performed. Steps performed after CROP might of course further shorten the read.
parameters.short_hint: The number of bases to keep, from the start of the read (e.g. tail crop 10 bases from a 150 base read: enter '         140         ').

parameters.description: Removes the specified number of bases, regardless of quality, from the beginning of the read.
parameters.short_hint: The number of bases to remove from the start of the read (e.g. head crop 10 bases: enter '         10         ').

parameters.description: Remove low quality bases from the beginning. As long as a base has a value below this threshold the base is removed and the next base will be investigated.
parameters.short_hint: Specifies the minimum quality required to keep a base at start of read.

parameters.description: Remove low quality bases from the end. As long as a base has a value below this threshold the base is removed and the next base (which as trimmomatic is starting from the 3  prime end would be base preceding the just removed base) will be investigated. This approach can be used removing the special illumina  low quality segment  regions (which are marked with quality score of 2), but we recommend Sliding Window or MaxInfo instead.
parameters.short_hint: Specifies the minimum quality required to keep a base at end of read.

parameters.description: This module removes reads that fall below the specified minimal length. Reads removed by this step will be counted and included in the '         dropped reads' count presented in the trimmomatic summary.
parameters.short_hint: Specifies the minimum length of reads to be kept.

parameters.short_hint: Should be a genome (KBaseGenomes.Genome)

Accept multiple floating point numbers between [-55.5, 55.5]
Just validate that it is a something.
Accept multple random strings

Accepts both KBaseGenomes.Genome or KBaseFBA.FBAModel
Should only accept what is in that dropdown.
Should accept only what is in the dropdown, but a list of them.
Accepts just True or False, should auto-map to actual value
A textarea
Maybe you want to write an article with lots of paragraphs?
This is the FBA model that will be used for populating subdata selection

parameters.short_hint: Used for a KBaseFBA.FBAModel (as in the example spec)
